content.description: Both climbs share their final 3 bolts, but the left variation starts left of the crack splitting the base of the pillar above the turret, the right starts right of the crack. The left variant has better holds, but further apart, and you can deck if you blow it before the third bolt. The right variant has smaller, less positive holds closer together, but has better clipping stances, and you'll only deck if you blow the second clip entirely.
content.location: Pillar down and right from the big Poker Face Alice roof. Look for a little castle-turret thing to belay from.

content.description: Juggy climbing through gentle bulges. Mantle onto aÂ ledge to clip the partially-hidden anchors.
content.location: This is the central of three lines on a small buttress just left of the prominent, overhanging Poker Face Alice roof.

content.description: The face at the entrance of the corridor to Outlaws on the Run and One Eyed Jack. Stem between the face and boulder, or climb the face only, through black, well featured rock. If something feels sharp, there is probably a better alternative nearby to grab.
content.location: Approach as for Poker Face Alice. This route is in the boulder-formed corridor on the way to Outlaws on the Run, Poker Face Alice, etc.

content.description: Steep bouldery route, good one too.  Climbs sequential pockets out the bulge.  Might be a bit soft at the grade -- or I read it well. Draw your cards!
content.location: PFA is located on a face to bulbous roof a short distance around to the left from Battle for a Wounded Knee.  It is also left of at least 2 lines on a small wall (10c,11b).  Poker Face Alice is the left line, while the right line is the bouldery Calamity Jane (13b).  Ante Up!

content.description: Another short easy route at the OK Corral. The crux is low on the wall. A fun jug haul completes this route after the first bolt.
content.location: Right most route on the dark slab to the left of the formation that contains Calamity Jane.

content.description: A short climb on a dark slab. Crux is getting above the second bolt to the chains.
content.location: Left most climb on dark slab to the left of the formation containing Calamity Jane.

content.description: Short, overhanging and bouldery. This route is in the alcove right of the Poker Face Alice roof. It is the left of two short routes on the wall. One long more off of bolt two.

climbs.name: Every Gun Sings its Own Song

content.description: Short, overhanging and bouldery.  It's about 45 feet long. This route is in the alcove right of the Poker Face Alice roof. It is the right of High Plains Drifter. One tricky section in the middle.

climbs.name: Don't Bring Your Guns to Town

content.description: This route is located in the same alcove as High Plains Drifter, but on the opposite wall. Powerful climbing to a very thin crux that is probably easier for taller folks. Do this route while it is in the shade.

The fact that no one has added this route until now surprises me, noting that this may be one of the more enjoyable 5.13's at the Iris. Pretty much a roped boulder problem that requires you to fly and crank on steep pockets.
content.location: Bolt line to the right of Poker Face.

pathTokens: 1. Left Side (Lunarscape, Tribal War, Poker-Face, Lone Pilgrim)
